In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function in Julia that wraps a string into lines of a specified width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end

    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return lines
end
```

You can use this function to wrap a string like this:

```julia
text = "This is a long text that needs to be wrapped into lines of a certain width."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)

for line in wrapped_text
    println(line)
end
```

This will output:

```
This is a
long text
that needs
to be
wrapped
into lines
of a
certain
width.
```

The `wrap_string` function splits the input text into words, then iterates over the words, adding them to the current line until the line would exceed the specified width. If a line would be too long, it starts a new line with the current word. Finally, it returns the list of lines.
